meanings.definition: To cause to forget or unlearn something previously taught.
meanings.sent1: She tried to unteach her dog the bad habit of jumping on the couch.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to unteach the incorrect information the students had learned.
meanings.sent3: It was a challenge to unteach the old method and introduce a new one.
meanings.sent4: The therapist helped him unteach the negative thought patterns.
meanings.sent5: He had to unteach himself the incorrect pronunciation he had picked up.

meanings.definition: To reverse the effects of teaching; to undo the process of learning.
meanings.sent1: The magician's trick was to unteach the audience's expectations.
meanings.sent2: The online course aimed to unteach common misconceptions about nutrition.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes seemed to unteach the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract painting seemed to unteach traditional art techniques.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance helped unteach the student's self-doubt.
